      • getDirection

        public static String getDirection(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The triangle direction: "d" for direct, "i" for indirect, "n" if neither. (NB: in its initial state, the 3 points are ordered to be direct)

      • istReverted

        public static boolean istReverted(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        Return if the triangle is reverted or not. (NB: in its initial state, the triangle is not reverted)

        Parameters:

      • getSlopeAngle

        public static double getSlopeAngle(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The angle between the horizontal plan and the triangle, between 0 and Pi, in radians. It is Pi/2 - zenital angle, or too the angle between the normal vector to the triangle and the vertical oriented up. 0 means the triangle is horizontal, Pi/2 it is vertical. Between Pi/2 and Pi, the triangle is reversed.

      • getSlopeVector

        public static double[] getSlopeVector(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The normed vector product of the triangle. That is the vector normal to the oriented triangle.

      • getSlopeAzimutalOrientation

        public static double getSlopeAzimutalOrientation(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The azimutal orientation of the slope vector, between -Pi and Pi, in radian, from the (O,x) axis. Returns -999.9 if the slope is not defined (horizontal triangle)

      • getInitialSlopeAzimutalOrientation

        public static double getInitialSlopeAzimutalOrientation(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The azimutal orientation of the slope vector in the triangle initial state, between -Pi and Pi, in radian, from the (O,x) axis. Returns -999.9 if the slope is not defined (horizontal triangle)

      • getSlopeAzimutalOrientationDifference

        public static double getSlopeAzimutalOrientationDifference(ITriangleFace tri,
                                                           double orientation)
        Parameters:
        orientation -
        Returns:
        The difference between -Pi and Pi, in radian, between the slope azimutal orientation and a given one. Returns -999.9 if the slope is not defined (horizontal triangle)

      • getSlopeAzimutalOrientationDifference

        public static double getSlopeAzimutalOrientationDifference(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        The difference between -Pi and Pi, in radian, between the slope azimutal orientation and the one in its initial state. Returns -999.9 if the slope is not defined (horizontal triangle)

      • contientBatiment

        public static boolean contientBatiment(ITriangleFace tri)
        Returns:
        True if a building is on the triangle, else false
